page.content:
HORSE RIDING IN BIGGIN HILL
An important form of recreation around Biggin Hill is horse riding and there are several riding stables. Much of the good quality farmland is given over to pasturing of the horses for riding rather than cattle and sheep. Horse riding is a rapidly growing sport for local residents and for people travelling into the countryside from London. In some areas, the land is neglected and there is a dustbowl of quagmire depending on the season, thick clumps of weeds and intricate fencing of barbed wire and corrugated iron. Around Biggin Hill there is a shortage of bridlepaths and so riders use roads, footpaths and farmland and there is conflict with other countryside users.
